image.altText: Bridget Archer standing and addressing the House of Represenatives

props.synopsis: Well known for crossing the floor during her two terms in federal parliament, former Liberal Bass MP Bridget Archer will seek a return to politics. She says she will seek preselection to run for the Tasmanian Liberals in a state election, which is yet to be called.

title.children: Bridget Archer to attempt immediate return to politics as election looms

image.altText: Two women in white and blue blouses smile down at a baby sitting next to windows with beige curtains.

props.synopsis: Meagan White says surrogacy was her only option to become a mother. Her own mother stepped in as surrogate twice. But others aren't so fortunate, and some say Tasmanian surrogacy law places unfair restrictions on those who choose surrogacy.

title.children: Calls to change Tasmania's 'unfair' surrogacy law

image.altText: Dean Winter standing in the chamber.

props.synopsis: The leaders of both of Tasmania's major political parties double down on their support for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium as an early election appears likely.

title.children: 'Not giving it up for anything': Tasmanian Labor leader firm on stadium

image.altText: Baz Luhrmann wearing a dark green and silver suit and Catherine Martin in a dark green long sleeve dress with silver flowers

props.synopsis: Some 830 Australians will be recognised as part of the King's Birthday 2025 Honours on Monday, including film director Baz Luhrmann and his frequent collaborator Catherine Martin, an award-winning costume, production and set designer.

title.children: King's Birthday Honours List includes Hollywood heavyweights, local heroes

image.altText: A woman clasps her hand in front of her face in front of a mirror

props.synopsis: Last year, more than 1,700 orders for involuntary electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) were approved by tribunals in Australia. Advocacy groups say clinicians need to be better informed.

title.children: Thousands of Australians receiving ECT without consent every year

image.altText: A selfie of Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya with a view of Hobart below them

props.synopsis: Police have discovered a crashed car and what are believed to be the bodies of tourists Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya two days after the couple were due home in Queensland.

title.children: Tasmanian police find bodies in search for missing Queensland couple

image.altText: Man stands and looks off camera

props.synopsis: Longer dry spells and higher intensity rainfall when it does rain — farmers are adapting to changing climate patterns.

title.children: Cattle to wine grapes: Climate change forcing Tasmanian farmers to pivot

image.altText: A woman with dark hair embraces a man in a suit with a solemn expression outside a red brick building.

props.synopsis: The atmosphere in the Devonport Magistrates Court was tense as Magistrate Robert Webster announced Rosemary Gamble was not guilty in the only criminal case to come from the Hillcrest Primary School jumping castle tragedy.

title.children: 'Broken' families tell of anger and disappointment following Hillcrest verdict

image.altText: Two men wrestle on inside a UFC octagon. Seen through the wire of its fence, one man straddles the other.

props.synopsis: Beneath the profitable success story of the UFC lies a hidden reality: many athletes who have dedicated their careers to the sport are struggling and are unable to fight back.

title.children: Former UFC fighters say they're the collateral damage of the sport's success

image.altText: A tennis player holds a fist up

props.synopsis: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has beat Italy's Jannik Sinner in the French Open final, retaining the title for a second straight year.

title.children: Alcaraz topples Sinner in marathon French Open final

image.altText: Climate activist Greta Thunberg speaks with the media ahead of the boat's departure from Italy.

props.synopsis: Israel's defence minister says the IDF has been ordered to stop a ship trying to carry humanitarian supplies to Gaza from reaching the war-ravaged territory.

title.children: 'Greta, you should turn back': Israel's ominous warning for Gaza-bound aid ship

image.altText: Military personnal wearing shield and holding guns lined up

props.synopsis: Hundreds of National Guard troops arrive in LA on the order of Donald Trump, following days of street protests against federal immigration raids.

title.children: National Guard troops arrive in Los Angeles amid protests against ICE

image.altText: A large grey sign that says Toowong Public Hospital.

props.synopsis: The private hospitals association blames the facility's shut down and the potential closure of others on health insurers, but a representative for insurers rejects the accusation and says how we fund mental health must change.

title.children: Private mental hospital closure in Brisbane 'just the tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: An Indigenous elder wearing a hat with feathers reads off a piece of paper into a microphone at a rally.

props.synopsis: Perth rally organiser and Indigenous elder Hedley Hayward said the community was standing alongside the rest of the country in demanding justice for Aboriginal people who had died in police custody.

title.children: Perth rallies against Indigenous deaths in custody in third day of protests

image.altText: Generic disposable coffee cup held in a hand with beach in background.

props.synopsis: US tariffs and supply issues are creating uncertainty for an already strained coffee market, and roasters say it's only a matter of time before Australians will pay more for their brew.

title.children: Coffee prices up to $12 needed to make industry viable, supplier says

image.altText: Jai Opetaia holds his belts

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia has retained his IBF and The Ring world cruiserweight titles by smashing Italian Claudo Squeo inside five rounds on the Gold Coast. Follow live.

title.children: 'I was in a rush': Jai Opetaia retains belts with brutal fifth round stoppage

image.altText: Colombia Senator Shot 1

props.synopsis: A potential presidential contender, Miguel Uribe Turbay was rushed to hospital after being shot twice in the head during a rally in Bogota.

title.children: Colombian senator fighting for life after being shot in head at rally

image.altText: Charles stands behind the open driver's side door of a vintage convertible sports car

props.synopsis: It's a public holiday for most of the country today as states and territories mark the King's Birthday. See how much you know about Charles with our quiz.

title.children: It isn't actually the King's birthday — but do you know when it is?

image.altText: Flowers and stuffed toys surround a photo of Pheobe Bishop on the ground.

props.synopsis: The mother of Queensland teen Pheobe Bishop, who police believe has been murdered, spoke at a vigil with hundreds of people.

title.children: Hundreds gather in Gin Gin at vigil for Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Fog covering a town.

props.synopsis: The Sunshine State is set for a cool wintry week with temperatures forecast to be below average from Tuesday.

title.children: Queensland braces for cold snap with below-average temperatures and frost

image.altText: Four people inside a tram making silly expressions, wearing blue school uniforms.

props.synopsis: From independent theatre La Mama to off-Broadway, queer satire Trophy Boys has taken off with its exploration of misogyny and masculinity, through drag and debating.

title.children: An inter-school, all-boys debate is the setting for this queer satire

image.altText: Pope Leo XIV in traditional pope hat looks to his side as he holds a sceptre featuring Christ on the cross.

props.synopsis: Pope Leo criticised the emergence of nationalist political movements around the globe on Sunday, calling them "unfortunate" — without naming a specific country or national leader.

title.children: Leo XIV, the first US-born pope, criticises nationalism at Sunday mass

image.altText: Baby twins, Max (left) and Blake (right) sit on their parents's laps wearing matching Bluey jumpers

props.synopsis: Researchers in Adelaide are looking to expand newborn heel-prick screening to help identify up to 600 additional genetic conditions early.

title.children: Expansion of newborn heel-prick screening hopes to pick up rare conditions

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan swimming over a lane rope in the pool, smiling, after winning a final

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's future swimming stars will battle this week to earn selection for this year's World Aquatics Championships.

title.children: Eyes on Adelaide as national swimming trials give first glimpse at future

image.altText: Three Brumbies players celebrate a try.

props.synopsis: Defeating the Chiefs in Hamilton is always a tough ask, but it's not mission impossible for the ACT Brumbies in next Saturday night's Super Rugby Pacific semifinal.

title.children: Why Brumbies can beat Chiefs in Super Rugby Pacific semis

image.altText: A black bed frame with dark sheets and a small table lamp nearby lit up in darkness.

props.synopsis: "Are you losing sleep tonight, like I am?" They're not just the lyrics to a country music heartbreaker but a question Australians should be asking each other to avoid some major health issues.

title.children: 'Every cell, every organ': Sleep issues affecting 40 per cent of Australians

image.altText: An SES vehicle and snowmobiles pictured on Mount Hotham during a rescue operation

props.synopsis: More than a dozen people have been rescued from Victoria's Mount Hotham, after several vehicles became stuck about 10:30pm last night due to heavy snowfall.

title.children: Thirteen people rescued on Mount Hotham as cars trapped in heavy snowfall

image.altText: Carlton players celebrate a goal

props.synopsis: Carlton sees a 38-point lead dwindle down to single digits before holding on a thrilling final quarter at the MCG.

title.children: Carlton survives manic Essendon comeback to claim thriller

image.altText: Nathan Cleary passes the ball as Jarome Luai defends.

props.synopsis: Jarome Luai gives away two pivotal second-half penalties as the Panthers beat the Tigers 18-14. Earlier, Canberra took top spot on the NRL ladder with an emotional win over the Rabbitohs.

title.children: Jarome Luai penalties cost Tigers against former Penrith teammates

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen displaying an American flag.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump warns Elon Musk could face "serious consequences" if his former ally and campaign benefactor tries to help Democrats in upcoming elections.

title.children: Trump warns of 'serious consequences' if Musk backs Democrats at midterms

image.altText: A young woman wearing a blue nurse's uniform smiles while holding up a babygrow

props.synopsis: Lucy Letby is currently serving multiple life sentences after being convicted of murdering seven babies and attempting to kill others. There's only one problem: the group of experts saying there's no evidence of wrongdoing.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Lucy Letby is in prison for life. There's just one problem

image.altText: Francesca Bridgerton seated at the piano in a gold gown.

props.synopsis: This year's audience poll of Australia's favourite classical music features the most music by women ever, thanks to their centuries-long connection with the piano.

title.children: How women have used the piano to push social boundaries for centuries

image.altText: James Paterson addresses the media at parliament house

props.synopsis: The Coalition remains committed to its defence spending target of 3 per cent of gross domestic product by the end of the decade, as Shadow Finance Minister James Paterson suggested the opposition would be open to considering broader tax reform.

title.children: Coalition open to broad tax reform as it sticks to defence spend pledge

image.altText: A person looking out into the ocean from a helicopter.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority says it detected a distress beacon from the recreational boat near the remote island about 4:30am.

title.children: Four rescued by helicopter from Hoskyn Island after boat begins to sink

image.altText: a whale in the ocean entangled with the cord around one of its fins

props.synopsis: The adult humpback whale, first spotted on Saturday, is travelling in the opposite direction to what it should be during the official whale migration season.

title.children: 'Distressed' whale entangled in rope, trailing a buoy spotted off Sydney
